topic: AI regulation and governance in the UK
summary: The UK government is actively engaging with stakeholders to refine its approach to AI regulation following the closure of a formal consultation period on June 21, 2023. The National AI Strategy emphasizes a pro-innovation framework for AI governance, aiming to position the UK as a global leader in AI by fostering an environment conducive to growth and public trust. The government has outlined its proposals in a white paper and is currently analyzing feedback from the consultation to further develop its regulatory framework.
takeaways: The formal consultation period on AI regulation closed on June 21, 2023.
The UK government is committed to a pro-innovation approach in its National AI Strategy.
AI is identified as one of five critical technologies in the UK Science and Technology Framework.
The government aims to strengthen the UK's position as a global leader in AI through effective regulation.
Stakeholders are encouraged to continue engaging with the government on AI issues.
